"I know that I heard voices with Chris Moon that I absolutely, positively c=
annot explain"

Just how much did that cost you?

And here is another probl=
em Frank, your name is associated with well known charlatans, con-artists,=
=C2=A0frauds, fly by night people looking to make a buck off a sucker.=C2=
=A0 

Your name, your product & your reputation.=C2=A0 Yet you do squat abo=
ut it.=C2=A0 Why is that Frank?=C2=A0 Your name is dragged=C2=A0 through th=
e mud by people like Moon (not his real name) and you just let it happen, w=
hy?=C2=A0 People like this are making money hand over fist and screwing peo=
ple that are in pain and real grief.=C2=A0 Why do you let this happen in yo=
ur name?
=C2=A0"Nature is showing us only the tail of the lion, but I have =
no doubt that the lion belongs to it even though, because of its large size=
, it cannot totally reveal itself all at once." 
-=E2=80=94 Albert Einstein=
 


"It is far better to grasp the universe as it really is than to persist=
 in delusions, however satisfying and reassuring."
--Carl Sagan


"There is=
 no such thing as an insignificant detail. Don't just look 
for what you wa=
nt to find."
-- Me LOL 




________________________________
From: Fiona Br=
oome <email@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thu, June 17=
, 2010 9:25:12 AM
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Tesing-testing

=C2=A0 
Hello,

We=
ll, what makes all of this intriguing for me is exactly that: It's so diffi=
cult to explain.

If all the answers were clear, I'd have checked it out, s=
aid, "Oh. That's what that is," and promptly quit this list.

It's the myst=
ery that keeps this interesting... wondering what the voices are, what the =
messages mean (and which ones are worth taking seriously), why some people =
seem to hear them better than others, and so on.

I know that I heard voice=
s with Chris Moon that I absolutely, positively cannot explain, except in t=
erms of a parallel world/reality, or something like that. And the replies t=
o what I was saying were completely illogical, if someone was trying to do =
a "cold reading." 

So, for me it's a mystery, and a fascinating one!

Chee=
rfully,
Fiona

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "purplespacefriend" <purplea=
liengirl@...> wrote:
>
... 
> 
> I get more than alittle annoyed by people =
that act like this stuff is all cut and dried, all perfectly understood, an=
d known--all easily explained. 
> 
> F-S
>
